name: Pushing
description: Riding and pushing on flat ground. The foundation of everything.
tips: Keep your front foot over the bolts, push with your back foot, keep your weight centered.

name: Tic-Tac
description: Shifting weight to lift the front wheels and pivot side to side to gain momentum.
tips: Press down on the tail slightly, swing your shoulders to guide direction.

name: Manual
description: Balancing on the back wheels while rolling.
tips: Find the balance point — lean back just enough without scraping the tail. Arms help balance.

name: Nose Manual
description: Balancing on the front wheels while rolling.
tips: Shift weight forward over the nose. Harder than a regular manual — commit!

name: Ollie
description: The foundational trick — popping the board into the air without using your hands.
tips: Pop the tail, slide your front foot up, jump with the board. Timing is everything.

name: Frontside 180
description: An ollie with a 180° frontside rotation.
tips: Wind up your shoulders before popping, let your body lead the rotation.

name: Backside 180
description: An ollie with a 180° backside rotation.
tips: Turn your head and shoulders backside, the board will follow.

name: Pop Shove-it
description: The board rotates 180° under your feet (backside) while you stay facing forward.
tips: Scoop the tail behind you, keep your shoulders straight, catch with your front foot.

name: Frontside Pop Shove-it
description: The board rotates 180° frontside under your feet.
tips: Scoop the tail in front of you. Less common but a great trick to have.

name: Kickflip
description: The board flips heelside while in the air. The king of flatground tricks.
tips: Flick your front foot off the heel edge of the nose. Commit to landing on the board.

name: Heelflip
description: The board flips toeside while in the air.
tips: Push your front heel off the toeside edge. Keep your shoulders level.

name: Varial Kickflip
description: A kickflip combined with a backside pop shove-it.
tips: Scoop and flick at the same time. The board does a lot — trust the catch.

name: Varial Heelflip
description: A heelflip combined with a frontside pop shove-it.
tips: Scoop frontside while flicking your heel. A stylish trick when done clean.

name: 360 Flip (Tre Flip)
description: A 360 backside pop shove-it combined with a kickflip. The holy grail.
tips: Big scoop, slight flick. Let the board do its thing and catch it.

name: Hardflip
description: A frontside pop shove-it combined with a kickflip.
tips: Scoop frontside and flick. The board goes between your legs — commit!

name: Boardslide
description: Ollie onto a rail or ledge and slide with the board perpendicular.
tips: Ollie high enough, turn 90°, keep your weight centered over the rail.

name: 50-50 Grind
description: Grinding on both trucks along a rail or ledge.
tips: Ollie onto the obstacle, lock both trucks, lean slightly forward to keep momentum.

name: 5-0 Grind
description: Grinding on only the back truck — a manual on a rail.
tips: Lock the back truck, keep your weight centered. Balance is key.

name: Nosegrind
description: Grinding on only the front truck.
tips: Ollie and shift weight to the nose. Coming off clean is the hard part.

name: Crooked Grind
description: A nosegrind at an angle, with the nose dipping over the edge.
tips: Lock into the nosegrind but angle your approach. Style it out.

name: Smith Grind
description: Back truck grinds while the board dips below the ledge/rail.
tips: Approach at a slight angle, lock the back truck, let the nose dip below.

name: Feeble Grind
description: Back truck grinds on top, front truck passes over the other side.
tips: Like a 50-50 but your front truck goes over. Lean into it.

name: Kickflip Boardslide
description: Kickflip into a boardslide. A proper tech trick.
tips: Kickflip early, spot the rail, lock in. Confidence is everything.

name: Drop In
description: Dropping into a ramp or bowl from the coping.
tips: Stomp your front foot down and lean forward. DO NOT lean back.

name: Rock to Fakie
description: Roll up a ramp, rock the front wheels over the coping, roll back fakie.
tips: Approach with speed, let the front wheels go over, shift weight back to roll in fakie.

name: Axle Stall
description: A 50-50 stall on the coping of a ramp.
tips: Ride up, turn 90° and lock both trucks on the coping, then drop back in.

name: Blunt to Fakie
description: Stall on the tail on top of the coping, then drop back in fakie.
tips: Pop up to blunt, balance for a moment, then shift weight to come back in.
